metadata.synopsis: What does it mean to be safe in school in the United States? Safe from what, and from whom? Bulletproof poses and complicates these questions through a provocative exploration of fear and American violence.

reviews: "Bulletproof" distinguishes itself from many other documentaries sharing its broad subject with its pointed focus on the cynical, profitable business of protection.
Bulletproof meshes the mundane rituals of school life with more recent preventative measures introduced to tackle potential incidents.
A smartly conceived look at the first generation of students to prepare for mass shootings and how fear of them has been commoditized.

The harsh reality and horrible frequency of school shootings has had a lasting impact on the U.S. educational system, with a generation of students and teachers growing up with lockdown drills and active shooter workshops...
